posts.message:
السلام عليكم

بنستخدم MongoDB و الـ Infrastructure عندنا كالتالي . 

1 -  عدد 1 مونجو راوتر ( Mongos )
2 - عدد 3  كونفج ( Mongo Config ) 
3 - عدد 3  شاردز ( Mongo Shard ) 

المشكلة الاولي ان كان فيه كولكشن مش بيعرض كل البيانات و كان قارئ عدد غلط من الشارد التالته .. اللي اكدلنا ان الشارد ٣ هي المشكله ان مساحه الداتا فيها كانت ٥٠ جيجا و المونجوس بيقول ان مساحتها ٣.٥ جيجا . بعد كذا محاوله علشان نعرف المشكله دي سببها ايه و نصلحها ازاي .. المونجوس مبقاش قارئ اي داتابيز خالص غير الادمن و الكونفج و الداتابيز بتاعتنا اختفت من المونجوس خالص مع ان الشاردز لسه فيهم الداتا و ال DB Path فيه ملفات المونجو اللي هي ( indexes , collections , wiredTrigger files ) .

بحثنا عن المشكلة دي كتير جداً و كانت الحلول كلها معتمده علي انه يكون عندك backup قبل كدا او انه يكون عندك Replica set .

المشكلة حالياً حسب تحليلي للي انا مرينا بيه لغايه دلوقتي ان الـ meta data اللي في ال config servers تتجمع من تاني من الشاردز .

فهل فيه اي اقتراحات ؟

Nice article. It shows the ability to use a single model to translate language pairs that the model has never been trained for. For example, training the model with Korean<->English, and Japanese<->English, allows direct (zero-shot) translation between Korean<->Japanese, without changing the model. 

The article cites this paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1611.04558v1.pdf and they have nice visualizations and possibly new insights about what the model is actually "learning" about the language (semantics vs direct phrase/phrase translation). Very interesting. 

https://research.googleblog.com/2016/11/zero-shot-translation-with-googles.html
posts.caption: research.googleblog.com
posts.description: Posted by Mike Schuster (Google Brain Team), Melvin Johnson (Google Translate) and Nikhil Thorat (Google Brain Team) In the last 10 years,...

posts.message:
Hello Geeks, 
My Macbook unable to open certain websites (actually all domains  in my shared hosting). 
I cannot find a solution on any forums yet that work for me. 
The issue has nothing to do with my Internet line, I can access those sites with no problems using my mobile device.
Not sure what else I can try. Does anyone have any suggestions?

For the .NET guys, when I saw an earlier post about Entity Framework issues, I remembered that I know things like Futures (sending multiple queries in one DB call), and second level caching (caching DB results in memory seamlessly) do exist with extensions for EF, but I wasn't sure if they exist for EF Core as well.

Google led me to this page http://www.zzzprojects.com/entity-framework-cache, and there I found this very nice looking gem for those interested in playing with it, supports .NET 4.x EF, and EF Core!
http://entityframework-plus.net/
posts.caption: entityframework-plus.net
posts.description: Extend and Overcome Entity Framework Limitations with Must-Have Features

Hello guys, 

I cant stop thinking about Mirai Botnet DDOS, i keep following the news to see it growing each day, the problem here is there are millions of unsecured IoT  devices that Mirai will acquire and the DDOS will get harder and harder each time, is there anyone interested in the same topic, does you know how this gonna stop, or they how they gonna batch all of those unsecured devices, what will happen after a year when this Botnet doubled several time ?
PDF: Technologies that will Impact your Business. How you can use this? is to simply watch for the trends and work on technologies from the Future :)

posts.message:
لو في حد عنده خبرة عملية في OpenStreetMap
أقصد بخبرة عملية أنه استخدمها في مشاريع أو حتى جربها
يا ريت يقول عن تجربته

للي ما يعرف أوبن ستريت ماب أو خريطة الشارع المفتوحة
دا مشروع لجمع بيانات الخرائط مفتوح المصدر
شبه ويكيبديا بس للخرائط
https://www.openstreetmap.org/
